properties.areaDesc: Wabash, IL; Knox, IN; Gibson, IN
properties.headline: Flood Warning issued January 17 at 10:27AM EST by NWS Indianapolis IN
properties.description:
...A Flood Warning continues for portions of the following waterways
in Indiana...

East Fork White River...Wabash River...White River...


.Minor to moderate flooding continued Friday morning in central and
southern Indiana. Crests will be/are comparable to those that
occurred in February and June of 2019.

The crest on the Wabash River is at Riverton, on the White River it
is approaching Petersburg, and on the East Fork White it is at
Shoals.  A precipitation event from Friday afternoon through Saturday
afternoon will bring either secondary crests or at least slower falls
to the river levels.  Flooding along the lower portions of the White
and Wabash River is likely to continue until about the end of the
month.

The Flood Warning continues for
The White River at Hazleton.
* until further notice.
* There have been no observations in the last 24 hours.
* Flood stage is 16.0 feet.
* Moderate flooding is forecast.
* Forecast...It is forecast to crest at 25.5 feet Saturday evening.
* At 26.0 feet...People in residential cabins on the riverward side of
the levee generally relocate.  Many local roads are completely
impassable.  Oil fields are inaccessible.  The remaining water
pumps are installed on the west end of Hazleton.
properties.instruction:
Precautionary/Preparedness Actions...

Motorists should never drive into flood water. Turn around and go
another way. Keep children away from flooded areas. Recreational and
agricultural interests should remain alert to changing river
conditions.

For detailed flood information go to weather.gov/ind on the web and
click on rivers and lakes.
